alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 9:32PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and southeastern Lincoln Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 930 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Matheson to 5 miles south of Punkin Center to 10 miles south of Forder, or along a line extending from 16 miles southwest of Limon to 73 miles west of Cheyenne Wells to 37 miles north of North La Junta. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hugo, Genoa, Boyero, Karval, Punkin Center, Kutch, Wild Horse Point and Forder. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. The strong winds will arrive well ahead of the storms. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
